title: 105_hr2543
content: The Act titled "Medicare and Medicaid Provider Review Act of 1997" requires certain providers to fund annual financial and compliance audits as a condition of participation in the Medicare and Medicaid programs. This includes the establishment of an annual financial and compliance audit fee schedule. The Act "Medicare and Medicaid Provider Review Act of 1997" mandates the Secretary to establish hourly rates for annual financial and compliance audits for healthcare providers receiving payment under title XVIII or XIX. Specially trained personnel will conduct audits to ensure provider compliance with payment requirements. The Medicare and Medicaid Provider Review Act of 1997 mandates audits for healthcare providers to ensure compliance with payment requirements. Covered providers include hospitals, nursing facilities, home health agencies, hospice programs, clinical laboratories, and ambulance services. Audits may also extend to related entities owned by the provider. The Medicare and Medicaid Provider Review Act of 1997 mandates audits for healthcare providers, including ambulance services. The Secretary may exclude low-volume providers receiving minimal revenues from Medicare and Medicaid. No rates shall be collected or audits conducted if appropriations for audits are insufficient. Annual payments to the Secretary are exclusively for financial and compliance audits. The Medicare and Medicaid Provider Review Act of 1997 mandates audits for healthcare providers, including ambulance services. Appropriations are specified for audits conducted by the Secretary for hospitals, skilled nursing facilities, home health agencies, and hospice programs under subsection (a). The Medicare and Medicaid Provider Review Act of 1997 mandates audits for healthcare providers, including ambulance services, clinical laboratories, hospitals, skilled nursing facilities, home health agencies, and hospice programs. The Act specifies annual payments to the Secretary for financial and compliance audits. The Medicare and Medicaid Provider Review Act of 1997 requires audits for healthcare providers, including ambulance services and clinical laboratories. Providers must make annual payments to the Secretary for financial and compliance audits. The Medicare and Medicaid Provider Review Act of 1997 mandates audits for healthcare providers, including ambulance services and clinical laboratories. Providers must make annual payments to the Secretary for financial and compliance audits. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will conduct a study on auditing agencies that examine and accredit covered providers. The Secretary will submit a report to Congress by June 1, 1999, with recommendations on coordinating audits and inspections to reduce duplication. The effective date for the amendments is January 1, 1998.
